reviewText: Make a simulator correct please. Big truck engines don't have spark plugs, Oil filters are under the engine and have one filter. reviewText:
Alittle disappointed to be honest, It's a decent game, but with it being released so close to Car Mechanic Sim 2015 i would of expected the same... quality.

To be honest, do i recommend this game? Well - there is no middle ground between yes and no, i'd say if you dont mind Car mechanic sim 2014, and want to work on big trucks, then this is the kinda game you'd enjoy. If you expected the same quality as you got from Car mechanic sim 2015, well - prepare to be very disapointed.

I think it's still fun, just, not what i was expecting.
voteText: 57 of 75 people (76%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I will recommend the game for the fact that it is different, but I can't help feel disappointed that it has been made on CMS 2014 engine and not the new CMS 2015 engine if it had been built on 2015 engine it would be whole different game

Game plays well and smooth but needs some more optimization in my opinion

If you're looking to buy this game it is similar to car mechanic simulator 2014

Pros:

different
Trucks look good
Fair amount of detail
Easy to use pretty much same as CMS 2014
Low system load


Cons:

Built on CMS 2014 engine
Limited truck models
Same level system/work orders as CMS 2014
Some parts are hard to remove due to camera position

reviewText: Truck Simulator 2015 ReviewBefore reading this review, here's a couple things to keep in mind: 1) I have played other sim" sorts of games such as Car Mech Sim and ETS2
date: 2) I am fairly critical of such games in my reviews
recommended: and 3) It works best to judge these games by splitting them up into their separate traits. With that being said
hoursPlayed: here we go!\n\nOriginality Truck Mechanic Simulator 2015 in a way piggybacks on other mechanic simulator games
voteText: but it does bring a couple fresh ideas to the genre. The first is just the fact that you get to work on big-rig style trucks
helpfulPercent: not just your everyday cars like in Car Mechanic Simulator 2014/2015. The Free Mode is a nice function
votesHelpful: but it's nothing more than what CMS had. In this respect
votesTotal: I could see this game as a DLC to CMS
votesFunny: but as a major expansion. This game could be like Dragonborn to CMS's Skyrim; both could stand alone (and one does)
commentsCount: and separately they have enough content to be separate games
column16: but when you put the both together
column18: more complete experience.The setup of the game is almost identical to CMS 2014/2015
column19: with similar "repair order" forms/tasks and a similar part purchase system. The ability to completely tear down a vehicle and rebuild it is still present
column20: which is nice.\n\nComplexity  TMS 2015 is both overly complex and not complex enough. I get that this can be confusing at first glance
column21: so to wrap your head around this statement
column22: let's start with one of the core components of a repair mission: inspecting parts. There are plenty of parts to inspect
column24: but the level of what you can actually do with the repairs and such is very low. There could be some repairs that require some innovative thinking
column25: but that simply isn't there. Maybe that's just personal preference
column26: but when you complete a few missions you'll see what I mean. The idea of being too complex is that in some repairs
column27: you have to go through every single part to find a single small thing that is in bad shape.\n\nGameplay  One of the issues with this game is simply how it plays. Although there is variety with the repair missions
column28: in each repair you run through the same processes and lose interest in the actual point of the game. However
column29: there is certainly enough content and enough different variety of repairs to keep the gameplay interesting even after hours of gameplay. If you like procedural games or just following directions well
column30: this game's for you. If creativity is your thing
column31: then give this game a shot
column32: but don't expect a ton of options of what to do.\n\nControls and Graphics TMS 2015 has basic point-and-click controls with basic movement around the trucks. However
column33: the controls system is convoluted in a number of ways. First
column34: when lifting the hood of a truck to inspect part conditions
column35: a number of parts cannot be inspected; however
column36: there is no indication that they can't - simply nothing happens. This becomes frustrating as you are unable to inspect what seem like relevant parts to the repair. Secondly
column37: the menu is very hard to adjust to when you are in inspect/assemble/disassemble mode. There are far too many times when I went to inspect a part and accidently ended up taking it off the engine block. This could be very easily fixed with a more simple mode-switch system
column41: etc. instead of the awkward menu. However
column42: I do feel like the developers worked on this issue with the mode-dependent cursor.\n\nAs for the graphics of the game
column43: from my understanding the game is actually created with a dated engine; however
column44: I personally don't feel that this really impacted the game in any negative way. The graphics are what you would expect from this line of games and there is no such "downgrade" with this game from previous games
column45: at least when it comes to graphics fidelity and controls movement. The trucks are very reminiscent of those from ETS2 (see Steam Curator Group link at bottom of review to check out our review of that game). The camera system of the game is a bit wonky at times
column46: but I was able to get used to it.\n\nEnjoyability See
column47: here's where I run into a bit of trouble when rating this game. Sure
column49: but the component of gamers who enjoy this genre of game is fairly small. With that being said
column50: if you are a fan of ETS2 or CMS
column51: don't hesitate to get this game - you will have hours of fun playing it. However
column52: if you are new to this genre of game
column53: I would not recommend starting with this game to get you into the simulator series. Not that the game isn't good
column54: it just simply isn't entertaining enough for a new player to enjoy as much as an experienced player would enjoy it. Because of this
column55:
I would have to give TMS 15 a lower score in this category.

Aspect        Rating                Originality        4                Complexity        6                Gameplay        5                Graphics        8                Enjoyability        8                Overall        6
Final Points on the Game TMS 2015 doesn't quite live up to its sibling game

reviewText:
A non-biased quick look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TFjLWoy9Y1g

Not as in-depth as the others in the series, but a good starting block if your new to this genre. Get ready for the big ones! This stunning simulator puts you in the front seat of a serious car workshop specialized in servicing trucks. With over 100 interactive parts per truck, this highly detailed title is not for the lightweight!

reviewText:
If you like car mechanic simulator 2014/2015 I think you also like this game,
But if you have recently played CMS 2015 and you know CMS 2014, you will be disappointed..
The game is based on CMS 2014 which I think is a missed opportunity...
If they made it look like CMS 2015 I think this game was much better...

Further there is nothing wrong with this game so I will give this a possitive review but I hope next year...
CMS 2016 and TMS 2016 will look like the same and got the same futures.
